reviewText: Four extremely unlikable women gather in Brazil for a bachelorette party that turns into a bloodbath for reasons so idiotic writer/director/actor Neil Jones would have been better off leaving the killings unmotivated.  Other than some fleeting nudity this movie has nothing whatsoever to recommend it--there's no suspense, the plotting is consistently illogical, the characters are not only annoying as hell but there's little indication on screen that any of them even like each other despite the fact that 3 of them took an expensive flight from Europe to Brazil for the party.  Lead actress Marcia Do Vales has such a thick accent that she probably has no business acting in English.  This is one of those movies where the filmmaker obviously had enough resources at his disposal to make a good film--the tech credits and acting other than Do Vales are all pretty slick--but there's no talent or imagination evident in the finished film.  Avoid.

Four girlfriends go to a secluded villa to have a bachelorette party. Gabby (Marcia Do Vales) is getting married to Michael and aspires to be an actress. Along with Gabby is Mary (Natalia Celino) a reclusive woman who claims to be a virgin, Silvia (Victoria Broom) who joined the mile high club on the way over, and Anna (Tabitha Quitman) who is the most normal in the group.

They hired a stripper for the night. Max, the dog is chained up outside. He bites, except Gabby who grew up with him. There is a locked room and no phone reception. It isn't long before things become unraveled and the blood flows.

This is a slasher film, whose twist I knew before I had any clues. The dialouge was border line. It lacked the humor normally associated with British slasher films. There are better slashers out there.

Parental Guide: F-bomb, sex, nudity (Natalina Celino)
an actual bad bad-movie.  Not worth watching
This is a classic example of someone's vision not translating to the movie. There wasn't even potential here.

What can you say about Deranged that hasn't already been said? It was not good.
At least you could see the actors and understand what they were saying (most of the time).

The women in  this one acting, or characters were too over the top to care much about, and I found it hard to believe these girls came from the same place... and what drove the killer seemed to have holes... it has its moments.

One word...Horrible!!! One of the worst movies I've seen in a long time and the lead actress was beyond horrible..they should've picked someone different...her accent was terrible.. the other girls weren't so bad but the lead actress was absolutely horrid
This movie is absolutely terrible... Awful acting and stupid movie plot
